{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.21514v1", "title": "Poncelet porism in singular cases", "summary": "The celebrated Poncelet porism is usually studied for a pair of smooth conics
that are in a general position. Here we discuss Poncelet porism in the real
plane - affine or projective, when that is not the case, i.e. the conics have
at least one point of tangency or at least one of the conics is not smooth. In
all such cases, we find necessary and sufficient conditions for the existence
of an n-gon inscribed in one of the conics and circumscribed about the other.", "main_category": "math.AG", "categories": "math.AG,nlin.SI", "published": "2025-04-30T11:08:18Z"}
